intro: Piper futokadsura var. macrophyllum, commonly known as the large-leafed pepper vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, elongated leaves that can reach up to 20 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by dark purple berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental and medicinal purposes.
